radiographic_examinations.findings: Mild gaseous distention of the small bowel and colon, increased soft-tissue density in the lower pelvis with no evidence of free intraperitoneal air.
Low lung volumes but otherwise normal.

Diffuse distention of both the small and large bowel; increased opacity within the pelvis thought to represent the postpartum uterus or a fluid collection. No evidence of free air on upright examination.
